A **beholder**, e, is a [deferred](/wiki/Deferred_feature "Deferred feature") [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") in the [source code](/wiki/Source_code "Source code") of *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. The beholder is a monster that is part of the [eye or sphere](/wiki/Eye_or_sphere "Eye or sphere") [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class"): it is [breathless](/wiki/Breathless "Breathless"), [mindless](/wiki/Mindless "Mindless"), capable of [flight](/wiki/Flight "Flight"), and can be seen via [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision").[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

A beholder has a [slowing](/wiki/Slowing "Slowing") [gaze attack](/wiki/Gaze_attack "Gaze attack"), a [sleep](/wiki/Sleep "Sleep")-inducing gaze, a [disintegration](/wiki/Disintegration "Disintegration") gaze, a gaze that inflicts [stoning](/wiki/Stoning "Stoning"), a [cancellation](/wiki/Cancellation "Cancellation") gaze, and a bite attack. Beholders possess [cold resistance](/wiki/Cold_resistance "Cold resistance").

## Generation

As a deferred monster, beholders are not generated at all, but have rules governing their generation like any other monster.

Randomly generated beholders will always be created hostile, and they are not a valid target for [polymorph](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph").

## History

The beholder first appears in [NetHack-- 3.0.10](/wiki/NetHack--_3.0.10 "NetHack-- 3.0.10"), and its vanilla data first appears in [NetHack 3.2.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.2.0 "NetHack 3.2.0").

## Origin

The beholder is a well-known creature from *[Dungeons & Dragons](/wiki/Dungeons_%26_Dragons "Dungeons & Dragons")*, one of the franchise's most iconic original creations. As described in the SLASH'EM encyclopedia entry (taken from a *D\&D* manual), beholders have spherical bodies with a single large eye, ten smaller eyes on stalks above it, and a mouth full of teeth. The smaller eyes are used for offense or defense; each one has a different magical ability. Beholders are typically hostile to other creatures, and often hostile to one another.

## Variants

Several variants of *NetHack* fully implement the beholder and its gaze attacks, while granting the monster additional traits and abilities depending on the variant.

### SLASH'EM

- *Main article: [Beholder (SLASH'EM)](/wiki/Beholder_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Beholder (SLASH'EM)")*

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") and [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"), the Beholder is the [quest nemesis](/wiki/Quest_nemesis "Quest nemesis") for the [Neutral Quest](/wiki/Neutral_Quest "Neutral Quest").

### GruntHack

- *Main article: [Beholder (GruntHack)](/wiki/Beholder_\(GruntHack\) "Beholder (GruntHack)")*

In [GruntHack](/wiki/GruntHack "GruntHack"), beholders are randomly generated and can appear in the main dungeon, and possess some additional resistances alongside their vanilla *NetHack* abilities.

### dNetHack

- *Main article: [Beholder (dNetHack)](/wiki/Beholder_\(dNetHack\) "Beholder (dNetHack)")*

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack") and [notnotdNetHack](/wiki/NotnotdNetHack "NotnotdNetHack"), beholders are much different and more dangerous than their *NetHack* incarnations. They are only generated in the [Chaos Temple Quest](/wiki/Chaos_Temple_Quest "Chaos Temple Quest") and [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom"), and have two gaze attacks that can select from various damage types, along with a third paralyzing gaze as a [passive attack](/wiki/Passive_attack "Passive attack") similar to the [floating eye](/wiki/Floating_eye "Floating eye"). Beholder corpses, tins and blood have some useful applications as well.

### SpliceHack

The beholder appears in older versions of [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack"), but is not implemented in [SpliceHack-Rewrite](/wiki/SpliceHack-Rewrite "SpliceHack-Rewrite").

### EvilHack

- *Main article: [Beholder (EvilHack)](/wiki/Beholder_\(EvilHack\) "Beholder (EvilHack)")*

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), beholders can appear in the main dungeon as in GruntHack, but are slightly faster and resist stoning, and have a stronger cancellation gaze and a much more powerful bite. [Tal'gath](/wiki/Tal%27gath "Tal'gath") is a powerful unique beholder who must be killed in order to genocide beholders.

### Hack'EM

- *Main article: [Beholder (Hack'EM)](/wiki/Beholder_\(Hack%27EM\) "Beholder (Hack'EM)")*

In [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"), the Beholder is the quest nemesis for the Neutral Quest as in SLASH'EM, but is much more difficult.

## References

A beholder, e, is a deferred monster in the source code of NetHack. The beholder is a monster that is part of the eye or sphere monster class: it is breathless, mindless, capable of flight, and can be seen via infravision.[1]

A beholder has a slowing gaze attack, a sleep-inducing gaze, a disintegration gaze, a gaze that inflicts stoning, a cancellation gaze, and a bite attack. Beholders possess cold resistance.
